sage.networking.client

Class TCPClientSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.net.Socket
      • sage.networking.client.TCPClientSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, IClientSocket

    public class TCPClientSocket
extends java.net.Socket
implements IClientSocket
    A client socket for sending and receiving packets using the TCP protocol. This socket is able to send and receive Serializable objects from client side of a game. The underlying Socket is used in this implementation.
    Author:
    Kyle Matz
    See Also:
    Socket

      Constructs a socket bound to the local address, local port and connected to the remote address and remote port.

      Constructs a socket connected to the remote address and remote port.
      TCPClientSocket(java.lang.String remoteAddr, int remotePort, java.net.InetAddress localAddr, int localPort)

    • Constructor Detail

      • TCPClientSocket

        public TCPClientSocket()
        Constructor to create an unconnected client socket. The socket should be connected via connectTo(InetAddress, int) before being used. See Socket.Socket().

                       int remotePort,
                       java.net.InetAddress localAddr,

        remotePort - remote port to connect to.
        localAddr - local address to bind to.
        localPort - local port to bind to.

        java.io.IOException

      • TCPClientSocket

        public TCPClientSocket(java.lang.String remoteAddr,
                       int remotePort)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a socket connected to the remote address and remote port. The remote address string form should be able to be resolved to an IP address via InetAddress.getByName(String). See Socket.Socket(String, int).
        Parameters:
        remoteAddr - remote address to connect to.
        remotePort - remote port to connect to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • TCPClientSocket

        public TCPClientSocket(java.lang.String remoteAddr,
                       int remotePort,
                       java.net.InetAddress localAddr,
                       int localPort)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a socket bound to the local address, local port and connected to the remote address and remote port. The remote address string form should be able to be resolved to an IP address via InetAddress.getByName(String). See Socket.Socket(String, int, InetAddress, int).
        Parameters:
        remoteAddr - remote address to connect to.
        remotePort - remote port to connect to.
        localAddr - local address to bind to.
        localPort - local port to bind to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • connectTo

        public void connectTo(java.net.InetAddress remoteAddress,
                      int remotePort)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Connects the client socket to the specified InetAddress and port. The client socket should be connected before being used. Uses Socket.connect(java.net.SocketAddress) to connect this socket to the address and port.
        Specified by:
        connectTo in interface IClientSocket
        Parameters:
        remoteAddress - the address to connect the socket to.
        remotePort - the port to connect the socket to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
